message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SD, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC

This paper discusses the adoption of new network control mechanisms for WLANs, which falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper specifically focuses on software-defined WLANs (SDWLANs), which is a subfield of software-defined networking (SDN) (cs.SD). The paper also discusses centralized network control mechanisms, which can be classified as a subfield of computer communications (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper discusses the problem formulation techniques used in these mechanisms, which can be classified as a subfield of control theory (cs.CC).
